thread.title: Reports: Kentucky set to hire former EKU coach Dean Hood
thread.title_full: Reports: Kentucky set to hire former EKU coach Dean Hood

title: Reports: Kentucky set to hire former EKU coach Dean Hood
text:
Manage Reports: Kentucky set to hire former EKU coach Dean Hood According to multiple reports, Kentucky is set to hire former Eastern Kentucky coach Dean Hood as special teams coordinator and outside linebackers coach. Slot to Kentucky Links (Photo: Kim Klement, USA TODAY Sports) 
After reports surfaced that Mark Stoops was set to fill his defensive line coaching vacancy with Derrick Leblanc of North Texas, it looks as though Kentucky is on the verge of completing its football staff. 
According to multiple reports, Stoops will likely hire former Eastern Kentucky head coach Dean Hood as special teams coordinator and outside linebackers coach. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
After compiling a 55-38 record over eight seasons as EKU head coach, Hood served as assistant head coach and tight ends coach at Charlotte last season. 
Kentucky special teams coordinator and inside linebackers coach Matt House was recently promoted to defensive coordinator after the departure of D.J. Eliot to Colorado. 
Stoops first attempted to hire Hood in the spring of 2016 to replace Andy Buh as outside linebackers coach and special teams coordinator after Buh left for Maryland. Author
